# Practice

Continue working on **`tidyverse`** lessons on DataCamp.


# Exercises

## Set up:

If you have just opened RStudio you will want to load the
**`tidyverse`** package

```{r}
#| code-fold: false
library(tidyverse)
```

## Reading in data

![](images/do_on_your_computer.png) Save this file in your `week-2` folder:

-   Data from fictional stress study: [stress_data.csv](../data/stress_data.csv)

![](images/do_in_R.png) Add the following code to your R script and run:

```{r}
#| include: false
# Load packages
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(here)
})

# Load data
stress_df <- read_csv(here("data-vis",  "data", "stress_data.csv"))

```

```{r}
#| eval: false
stress_df <- read_csv("stress_data.csv")
```

```{r}
head(stress_df)
```

## Plot

![](images/do_in_R.png) Generate a boxplot that shows the relationship between diagnosis on the x-axis and stress_score on the y-axis. Facet the plot by sex so that this relationship is plotted separately for Female and Male.

```{r}
#| echo: false

ggplot(stress_df, aes(x = diagnosis, y = stress_score)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_wrap(~ sex)
```
